discovery.problem: Manual handling of elderly care orders via phone/messages creates operational overhead and makes it difficult to track orders, specialist availability, and working hours
discovery.audience: Families needing elderly care services in Israel, care specialists, and company administrators
discovery.coreValue: Simple digital platform for ordering and managing elderly care services with real-time tracking
keyFeatures: Easy service ordering without mandatory registration
discovery.constraints: Israel market, Hebrew RTL support, SMS-based verification

access.rolePermissions:
Client: Create orders, view own orders, track status, leave reviews
Specialist: View assigned orders, mark work start/end, set availability
Admin: Full access - manage orders, specialists, assignments, view all data
access.guestFlows: Clients can order without registration, identified by phone

data.entityFields:
User: id, email, password, name, avatar, role (USER|ADMIN|SPECIALIST|CLIENT), isActive, createdAt, updatedAt
Client: id, userId?, phone, name?, city?, address?, createdAt, updatedAt
Specialist: id, userId?, phone, name, email?, avatar?, isActive, rating, reviewCount, createdAt, updatedAt
Admin: id, userId, createdAt
Order: id, orderNumber, clientId, serviceId, specialistId?, cityId, clientPhone, clientName?, address, addressNotes?, date, startTime, duration?, status (CREATED|REVIEWING|ASSIGNED|ON_WAY|IN_PROGRESS|COMPLETED|PAID|CANCELLED), notes?, actualStart?, actualEnd?, estimatedPrice?, finalPrice?, paidAmount?, paidAt?, paymentNotes?, createdAt, updatedAt
Service: id, code, name, description, category (CARE|MEDICAL|HOUSEHOLD|TRANSPORT), icon?, isActive, sortOrder
City: id, name, region?, isActive, sortOrder
Availability: id, specialistId, date, startTime, endTime, isBooked
Review: id, orderId, clientId, rating (1-5), comment?
Notification: id, userId, type, title, message, data?, isRead
OtpCode: id, phone, code, expiresAt, isUsed
OrderEvent: id, orderId, status, note?, createdAt, createdBy?
data.relationships:
User -> Client (one-to-one optional)
User -> Specialist (one-to-one optional)
User -> Admin (one-to-one optional)
User -> Session (one-to-many)
User -> Notification (one-to-many)
Client -> Order (one-to-many)
Client -> Review (one-to-many)
Specialist -> SpecialistServiceType -> Service (many-to-many via junction)
Specialist -> SpecialistCity -> City (many-to-many via junction)
Specialist -> Availability (one-to-many)
Specialist -> Order (one-to-many)
Service -> Order (one-to-many)
City -> Order (one-to-many)
Order -> Review (one-to-one)
Order -> OrderEvent (one-to-many, audit history)
data.requiredFields: Order: clientId, serviceId, cityId, clientPhone, address, date, startTime
data.validationRules: Phone: Israeli format, Date: future dates only, Rating: 1-5
data.dataLifecycle: CREATED -> REVIEWING -> ASSIGNED -> ON_WAY -> IN_PROGRESS -> COMPLETED -> PAID

features.navigationMap:
Client App: Home -> OrderForm, OrderTracking, OrderHistory
Specialist App: Home -> Orders, ActiveShift, Availability (bottom nav)
Admin App: Dashboard, Orders, Specialists (bottom nav)
features.primaryUserJourney:
1. Client opens app -> fills order form (phone, service, location, date)
2. Order created -> SMS confirmation
3. Admin reviews -> assigns specialist
4. Specialist sees order -> goes to location
5. Specialist marks start -> work in progress
6. Specialist marks end -> shift completed
7. Client can track status anytime
8. Client leaves review after completion
features.userStories:
As a client, I want to order care services easily without creating an account
As a client, I want to track my order status in real-time
As a specialist, I want to see my assigned orders and mark work progress
As a specialist, I want to set my availability for the week
As an admin, I want to see all orders and assign specialists
As an admin, I want to manage specialists and their service areas
features.errorHandling: Toast notifications for errors, form validation
features.emptyStates: No orders yet, No specialists available

schema.indexes: orders(clientId, specialistId, status, date, createdAt), availabilities(specialistId+date, date+isBooked), notifications(userId+isRead)
